text: (Sound of Krishna playing his flute)
In Vrindavan, Krishna planned to go for a picnic in the forest.
So, Krishna organized a small meeting with his friends.
Why don't we picnic in the pastures today?
It Would be great fun,
but with all the dangerous creatures around the forest.
we can't take care of our herds properly there.
Don't be afraid.
Why should we fear, when Krishna's with us?
Let us enjoy our day as per Krishna's plan.
With Krishna as their leader playing the flute,
all the other boys followed him with slings, sticks, horns
and pots of curd and rice.
Aghasur, the brother of Puthana and Bakasur,
he decided to transform himself Into a huge python
and lay in the path of the herd.
He Opened his mouth, which presented the appearance of a big cave
with his lower lip touching the earth, and the upper lip, touching the sky.
The boys mistook it as a very big cave in the forest
and entered the cave laughing loudly and clapping their hands.
Krishna very well knew that,
it was a real python and that, it was sure death to enter the mouth of the creature.
The python patiently waited for Krishna to enter.
Krishna entered slowly Into the mouth of the python.
It closed its mouth and was about to swallow them.
Now everyone realized it was a living python
and they all became scared.
Krishna acted fast and walked straight up to the throat and began to expand his body.
Now everybody run out of its mouth.
When Krishna made sure that every one of them had passed,
Krishna increased his stature a little bit more.
The python gasps its last breath and died.
Krishna Krishna  Krishna Krishna
Krishna Krishna  Krishna Krishna
